ksdk:manifest.name: SDK version 2.3.1 package for FRDM-KL02Z board
ksdk:manifest.brief: This is SDK version 2.3.1 manifest file. It describes the content of the SDK version 2.3.1 package for FRDM-KL02Z board and additional settings for tools that support SDK version 2.3.1

board.name: FRDM-KL02Z
board.description: FRDM-KL02Z: Freedom Development Platform for the Kinetis KL02 Family

specific.content:
The FRDM-KL02Z is an ultra-low-cost development platform enabled by the Kinetis® L series KL02 family built on the ARM® Cortex®-M0+ processor.
Features include the open standard embedded serial and debug adapter (OpenSDA), providing easy access to MCU I/O, battery-ready, low-power operation, a standard-based form factor with expansion board options and a built-in debug interface for flash programming and run-control. The FRDM-KL02Z is supported by a range of NXP® and third-party development software.
This hardware can be purchased through NXP distribution partners.

device.name: MKL02Z4
device.description: KL02: Kinetis® KL02-48 MHz, Dual I2C, Small packages, Entry-Level Ultra-Low Power Microcontrollers (MCUs) based on ARM® Cortex®-M0+ Core

specific.content:
As an entry point to the Kinetis® L series, the KL02 chip-scale package (CSP) MCU offers one of the world's smallest ARM Powered® microcontrollers for low-power devices, remote sensing nodes, portable consumer devices, and ingestible healthcare sensing.
  • Consumes 25 percent less PCB area, while delivering 60 percent more GPIO than the nearest competitor
  • Allows designers to dramatically reduce their board size without compromising performance, feature integration, or power consumption of end products
  • Promotes multiple, flexible, low-power modes
  • Supported by a cost effective development platform for quick application prototyping and demonstration
